message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.CC, cs.SI 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses decoding of LDPC codes using linear programming, which is a common technique in information theory. 
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes new algorithms for calculating lower bounds on the minimum and fractional distance of LDPC codes, which falls under the scope of data structures and algorithms. 
3. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper may be relevant to distributed computing as LDPC codes are commonly used in distributed storage systems. 
4. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the complexity of the proposed algorithms for calculating lower bounds on the minimum and fractional distance of LDPC codes. 
5. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - LDPC codes are used in communication networks, which may fall under the scope of social and information networks.
